Hands down one of the greatest games of all time. If you've got Steam, chances are you have probably thought about buying Half Life 2 - you may even have it from some kind of bundle, more notably The Orange Box. You can probably do the entire campaign in about 15 hours, give or take - but if you want to take the time to explore and add in a few extra hours to play around with the mechanics, you can do that as well.

It's also worth mentioning that since Half Life: Alyx has *kind of/probably/maybe* confirmed a sequel (of some kind; whether it's a 3 or some variation of a 3/third), it may be worth getting invested into the story and characters again.

It's definitely a timeless classic and I recommend it to every kind of gamer.

Easily the most severely overrated game ever made. Maybe at the time it was released the physics engine seemed like an impressive tech demo, but absolutely nothing in this game holds up to modern standards of quality. The graphics and physics are no longer impressive, and the level design, combat, and "puzzles" leave a lot to be desired. It is, in almost every way relevant to gameplay, a strict downgrade from the original Half Life, and represents a major kicking-off point for a collection of broken game design philosophies that still haunt us today, wherein developers prize being "cinematic" above all, trying and failing to make what is essentially an interactive movie, rather than playing to the strengths of games as a medium.

No matter how historically relevant it might be, a bad game is ultimately still bad.
Instant cult classic, it will never age.

The sequel to one of my favorite games of all time, does it surpass the original? yes it does, with a lot more creative weapons and a grander story with more interesting characters and better graphics it surpasses the first half life... The only problem I have with this game is that it's a lot more narrative this time around, meaning that it has to take control away from you sometimes to get points across for the story. Now it's not a bad thing it just slows things down a lot, with the first game beatable in around 4-5 hours by anyone who knows how FPS's work and puzzles, this game on the other hand will take around 8-10 with how long it is and how dragged out some parts are. It's still a great game and a MUST play for anyone who has a laptop or computer that can run smaller sized games.

The thing is this game isn't just a remaster, though it still stays true to Half-life 1, it comes into its own pretty early on in the game. For example, some levels have been completely redesigned, and some have been added entirely. Which brings me on to the fact that the game has added so much to what the original game was, which you can see really clearly in the Xen, where it feels like what the original half life was trying to achieve with it. 10/10 would recommend.
Игре уже 16 лет... А её графика до сих приятна глазам)

As I've been playing these games in chronological order, I finally hit Half Life 2. Let me tell you, as someone who isn't through the whole story quite yet, this is quite possibly the best game. The upgrade from the original + the two dlc games to this... it is just astounding. The physics engine can be quite hilarious and the universe just feels so lived in. The supporting cast is nothing short of perfect. Barney, Dr. Kleiner, Eli Vance, Alyx Vance, Mossman, Dr. Breen, G-Man, and then you have Gordon. Gordon feels so much more important in this installment. I highly recommend this game to anyone. This is Valve at their best and it really shows. Masterful story telling, masterful gameplay. A legend of a game.

Сюжет мені не дуже сподобався він простенький доволі і атмосфера порівняно з першою частиною зникла, проте доволі багато нововведень таких як машини і відкриті великі рівні. Звук на нормальному рівні. Рекомендую цю гру. Оцінка 8 з 10 балів.
